intro: Shuteria annamica, commonly known as the Annamica shuteria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
